newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Yue Xiu buys 9.0pct of S.China Brokerage.
newsitem.headline: Yue Xiu buys 9.0pct of S.China Brokerage.

text.p: South China Holdings Ltd said it sold nine percent of its listed financial arm, South China Brokerage Co Ltd, to China's Yue Xiu Enterprises (Holdings) Ltd for more than HK$100 million.
The shares were sold at HK$0.35 per share and the transaction was recorded on the stock exchange on Monday, said Christina Cheung a director of South China Holdings.

"Proceeds from the sales amounted over HK$100 million and the money will be used to cut debt and for projects under negotiation," Cheung told reporters after an annual general meeting of South China Holdings.
Cheung declined to give details on the projects.
South China Holdings' interest in South China Brokerage fell to 66 percent from 75 percent after the deal, she said.
Yue Xiu, the Hong Kong investment arm of the Guangzhou municipal government, was expected to have some sort of cooperation with South China Brokerage.
"Both sides have an intention to do some work (together)," Cheung said, but she did not give any detail.
South China Brokerage has kept a close eye on the development of China's financial services market but it has no formal presence in China after recently closing a consultancy company in Guangzhou.
